title: Peter Vogelzang
text:
Peter Vogelzang (born 11 February 1945, <a href="Utrecht%20%28city%29">Utrecht</a>) is a Dutch businessman and member of the <a href="board%20of%20directors">board of directors</a> of <a href="Feyenoord%20Rotterdam">Feyenoord Rotterdam</a>. Vogelzang worked as a director for the <a href="Royal%20Dutch%20Football%20Association">Royal Dutch Football Association</a> (KNVB) and is part of the board of directors of the KNVB as well. He was Chef de Mission of the <a href="Dutch%20Olympic%20Committee">Dutch Olympic Committee</a> during the <a href="2004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Athens">Athens</a>.
At Feyenoord Vogelzang was appointed in April 2007 for a period of five months. He is the central person for all directors and board members which have a goal to restructure the club after <a href="Jorien%20van%20den%20Herik">Jorien van den Herik</a> was forced to resign. With the appointment of Vogelzang commercial director <a href="Chris%20Woerts">Chris Woerts</a> and Director Finance and Operations <a href="Onno%20Jacobs">Onno Jacobs</a> can focus on more specific subjects in their jobs. Under his regime Feyenoord started two "talent pools" of which several talented players of the club, including <a href="Royston%20Drenthe">Royston Drenthe</a>, <a href="Jonathan%20de%20Guzman">Jonathan de Guzman</a>, <a href="Luigi%20Bruins">Luigi Bruins</a>, <a href="Ron%20Vlaar">Ron Vlaar</a>, <a href="Andw%C3%A9l%C3%A9%20Slory">Andwélé Slory</a> and <a href="Georginio%20Wijnaldum">Georginio Wijnaldum</a> are part. Fans of the club with a lot of money, mostly directors of companies are able to invest 250,000 <a href="euro">euro</a>s each in the talent pool, eventually they will be awarded a total of 25% of the profit that is made out of selling the players in the talent pools. The pools were successful from the beginning and the first one was sold out within a few weeks, which resulted in the start of the second pool which also turned out to be a success. Unless financial trouble and a disappointing season for Feyenoord in which they were excluded for the <a href="UEFA%20Cup">UEFA Cup</a>, only finished 9th in the <a href="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a> and missed out on European football for the next season Feyenoord was able to do some surprise signings. Players like <a href="Giovanni%20van%20Bronckhorst">Giovanni van Bronckhorst</a>, <a href="Tim%20de%20Cler">Tim de Cler</a>, <a href="Kevin%20Hofland">Kevin Hofland</a> and <a href="Roy%20Makaay">Roy Makaay</a> (all <a href="Netherlands%20national%20football%20team">(former) Dutch internationals</a>) were purchased with money that was made available out of the talent pools. Vogelzang will stay at the club until October 2007.
